eventDetails.keyword: Comedy Thursday May 2010
eventDetails.title: Comedy Thursday May 2010
eventDetails.short_description: Malaysia's most popular stand-up night is back with numerous acts and some newbies dying to cut their teeth and grab some heckles....
eventDetails.descripton:
TNT Time Out Comedy Thursday is back on May 6 and tickets are already selling out fast. Maybe word has got around that the there is a distinctly international flavour to the acts including Canada's finest Mr Steve Northcott, Australian uber-icon Mr Jeremy Malcolm and Malaysia's one and only Mr Papi Zak.
  
That isn't all with another act to be confirmed, the usual first-timer and special MC whose identity has to be kept private for fear of stalkers and ladyfolk harassing the poor man. To find out which member of the dynamic YCOM/TOCT team it is and laugh yourself rotten join the crowds this May 6.
 
Last month, unperturbed by the F1 circus being in town and the event falling on the auspicious date of April's Fools Day, the event was another spectacular with hundreds more KL-ites guffawing it up at Velvet Underground in Zouk KL, where you can sample food promotions and the usual buy-one-free-one, that's BUY-ONE-FREE-ONE, on beer.
 
If you haven't found out for yourself what all the fuss is about with TOKL stand-up comedy nights, get down to TNT Time Out Comedy Thursday this May 6. Simply RSVP to events@mongooseasia.com with your name and contact number to gain entry at only RM15 instead of the usual RM25 door price. You can also purchase your discounted tickets via our online ticketing payment system (online ticketing gateway closed) or download the online discounted voucher here.
 
See you there!
 
REMINDER: Zouk's age and dress code policy is adhered to STRICTLY, so no flippers or shorts. The venue retains the right to deny entry for patrons under 21 years of age.

address_details.venue_address: Velvet Underground, Zouk KL, 113, Jalan Ampang, KL

eventDetails.price: RM25 (Door) / RM15 with online voucher (URL above) or online ticketing payment

eventDetails.keyword: Deepak Menon Film Showing and Conversations, CHAI house,
eventDetails.title: Deepak Menon Film Showing and Conversations
eventDetails.short_description: Come meet Deepak Menon, one of the most influential independent Tamil film director in Malaysia....
eventDetails.descripton:
Come meet Deepak Menon, one of the most influential independent Tamil film director in Malaysia. Watch the screenings of his films. Afterward, have a chat with him, his mother Sooria Kumari, a retired Tamil school teacher and the co-writer of his film Chemman Chaalai and some of the cast most of whom were amateurs.

8.30pm, Saturday, May 7
Chemman Chaalai (The Gravel Road)
- Chemman Chaalai is a drama set in the 1960s in a rubber estate in Malaysia. The story revolves around Shanta and her rubber tappers family living in the estate. Shantha aspires to leave the estate and further her studies. However, due to many unfortunate circumstances this dream becomes a difficult one to achieve.

Director's Note
Malaysian Indians have little control on the economy and politics in Malaysia. A way forward would be education. The film emphases the importance of education for the growth of the community and nation.

8.30pm, Sunday, May 8
Chalanggai (Dancing Bells)
- Uma lives with her mother, Muniammah, and elder brother Siva, in a soon to be demolished neighborhood secluded in the backyards of the rapidly developing Brickfields. Chalanggai is a beautifully realistic and detailed portrait of a family that has to survive and above all has to maintain its dignity. The film was shot entirely on location in Brickfield and the cast is made up of local amateurs.

address_details.venue_address: CHAI House, No 6, Jalan 6/3, Off Jalan Templer, PJ

eventDetails.keyword: Nordic Film Festival, popular and award-winning films, Sweden, Denmark, Finland, Norway
eventDetails.title: Nordic Film Festival
eventDetails.short_description: The first ever Nordic film festival in Malaysia brings together a program of nine popular and award-winning films from...
eventDetails.descripton:
The first ever Nordic film festival in Malaysia brings together a program of nine popular and award-winning films from Sweden, Denmark, Finland and Norway. Organised by the Nordic embassies in Malaysia, the festival will be held at two locations - HELP University College and Taylor's University College (Lakeside Campus) from May 4 - 7. Admission is free.

For further enquiries, please call 03 2052 2550 or visit www.swedenabroad.com/kualalumpur
 
Tues 4 May, 6.30pm (HELP)
ONE RED EYE (Ett öga rött)
Sweden; dir Daniel Wallentin; 2007, 91 mins
Special appearance by award-winning Swedish director Daniel Wallentin, who will meet audiences for Q&A after the screening.
- Halim gets wind of an Integration Plan-a conspiracy that attempts to turn all immigrants into Swedes. He hatches a plan to become Sweden's powerful sultan of the mind and save his father from forgetting his Arabic roots. [Comedy]

Wed 5 May, 8.30pm (HELP) / Thurs 6 May, 7.30pm (Taylor's)
LET THE RIGHT ONE IN (Låt den rätte komma in)
Sweden; dir Tomas Alfredsson; 2008, 114 mins
- Based on the John Ajvide Lindqvist novel of the same name, the film follows the footsteps of 12-year-old Oskar who lives in Stockholm. He encounters his new neighbour, a girl called Eli who strangely only comes out at night, cannot be in the sun and doesn't consume food. [Horror]

Fri 7 May, 5.30pm (Taylor's)
MAMMOTH (Mammuth)
Sweden; dir Lukas Moodysson; 2009, 125 mins
- Successful couple Leo and Ellen are a website creator and emergency surgeon respectively. When Leo makes a business trip to Thailand, he unwittingly sets off a chain of events that will alter everyone's lives. [Drama]

Tues 4 May, 8.45pm (HELP ) / Wed 5 May, 5.30pm (Taylor's)
DEAD SNOW (Død Snø)
Norway; dir Tommy Wirkola; 2009, 90 mins
- Eight medical students on a skiing vacation become trapped when they realise that they've arrived at the wrong resort. They soon discover a box full of Nazi gold and encounter a battalion of German zombie soldiers that are looking to rip them to pieces. [Horror Comedy]

Thurs 6 May, 6.30pm (HELP)/ Fri 7 May, 7.45pm (Taylor's)
LONG FLAT BALLS (Lange Flate Ballær)
Norway; Bjørn Fast Nagell; 2006, 100 mins
- Six men working together at the Ed Garage decide to embark on a trip to support the Norwegian national soccer team at the World Championship. Their decision comes at the threat that their garage will be going bankrupt. [Comedy]

Thurs 6 May, 5.30pm (Taylor's) / Fri 7 May, 8.30pm (HELP)
FORBIDDEN FRUIT (Kielletty hedelmä)
Finland; dir Dome Karukoski; 2009, 110 mins
- Two teenage girls, Maria and Raakel, run from their fundamentalist community to look for a summer job in the city. Maria is the adventurous one, looking to experience new things before getting married. The other girl, Raakel, is less adventurous and only wants to make sure Maria does return. The summer of temptations changes the life of one of the girls - for good. [Drama]

Tues 4 May, 7.30pm (Taylor's) / Wed 5 May, 6.30pm (HELP)
FC VENUS
Finland; dir Joona Tena; 2005; 107 mins
- Anna makes a bet with her football-crazy husband, Pete: she puts a team of female footballers together and challenges Pete's team to a match. If the women win, the men must give up the sport. If the men win, the women are obliged never to complain about the men watching football ever again. [Romantic Comedy]

Wed 5 May, 7.30pm (Taylor's) / Fri 7 May, 6.30pm (HELP)
KARLA'S WORLD (Karlas Kabale)
Denmark; dir Charlotte Sachs Bostrup; 2007, 92 mins
- 10-year-old Karla has a mission to reunite her whole family just in time for Christmas. This will be no easy task, considering the fact that her parents are divorced and she has two obnoxious and bratty younger brothers who are always acting up. [Drama]

Tues 4 May, 5.30pm (Taylor's) / Thurs 6 May,  8.30pm (HELP)
THE CANDIDATE (Kandidaten)
Denmark; dir Kasper Barfoed; 2008, 94 mins
- Defence attorney Jonas suddenly finds himself accused of murder. His father's mysterious death the year before comes into the mix as he vows to prove his innocence by hunting for the people that threaten to frame him for the murder. [Thriller]

Venues:

Taylor's University College Lakeside Campus, No 1 Jalan Taylor's, PJS 7/13, Subang Jaya and HELP University College, Jalan Dungun, Pusat Bandar Damansara, KL

With Mother's Day just around the corner, pamper your mother with reminiscence of Chinese oldies by Yudi at The Westin Kuala Lumpur this May with a sumptuous brunch, hi-tea, a glass of bubbly and exclusive surprises from Dr. Sebagh and Laura Mercier. You will be spoilt for choice with diverse cuisines from EEST, Prego and The Living Room.

On this special occasion, EEST presents the show accompanied by a six-course dinner menu at RM188++ per person from 6:30pm to 10:30pm.

During the day, mothers who enjoy Asian flavours will appreciate EEST with its extensive Chinese menu and dim sum selections freshly made-to-order by our Dim Sum chef at his very own hot steam kitchen right in the middle of the restaurant. The Dim Sum Brunch is available from 11:30am to 2:30pm and priced at RM88++ per person and RM44++ per child.

Mothers dining in EEST are entitled to redeem one Laura Mercier mini foundation Primer 15ml worth RM50 and a lip plumper worth RM25. In addition, upon presentation of the dining bill at any Laura Mercier counter they are eligible to purchase the Laura Mercier special Mother's Day 'Flawless Foundation Starter Kit' at a discounted price of RM199 (usual price is RM373). Laura Mercier Counters are located at Bangsar Village II and Pavilion KL.

For the love of fun, laughter and surprises, Mother's Day celebration at Prego will be delightful. The Mother's Day Bubbly Brunch is an all-you-can-eat hearty brunch featuring generous offerings of Italian cuisine with free flow of Veuve Clicquot premium champagne to toast all mothers. The brunch starts from 11:30am to 2:30pm and priced at RM268++ per person with free flow of champagne or RM168++ per person with non-alcoholic drinks and RM84++ per child.

Mothers dining in Prego will receive an exclusive gift from Dr. Sebagh comprising a voucher to redeem one Supreme Maintenance Serum 5ml worth RM 110 or Rose de Vie Serum 5ml priced at RM130. In addition, upon presentation of the dining bill at any Dr. Sebagh counter, mothers are eligible to purchase the Skin Perfecting Kit which at only RM379 (usual price is RM732). Dr Sebagh counters are located at Bangsar Village II and KLCC.

While at The Living Room, reward your mother with a buffet hi-tea ~ a sumptuous hi-tea with a selection of international and local flavours to suit your palate. This delectable buffet hi-tea is priced at RM88++ per person and RM44++ per child from 12 noon to 4pm.

Starwood Privilege card members are entitled to 10% dining discount for all brunches, hi-tea and dinner at EEST.

eventDetails.keyword: Heineken Green Space Served by Car Crash Hearts
eventDetails.title: Heineken Green Space Served by Car Crash Hearts
eventDetails.short_description: Join Car Crash Heart as they film their new single's music video at the Heineken Green Space...
eventDetails.descripton:
Do not look down on Facebook status. While people use Facebook to stalk their ex-lovers and spam others with viral marketing scams, bassist Alda found his bandmates after he posted a comment in his profile status. Collin Chin (guitar and vocals), Aliff Zulkifli (second guitar) and Waffiey Hassan (drums) contacted Alda and they happily went for a jam session to check out the group's musical chemistry. The result? It was good news and Car Crash Hearts was officially born.

The band recently released their latest single 'Just a Face in the Crowd' and they wanted to do something different with the music video. Instead of the cliché punk-rock gimmicks like guitar-smashing and hysterical screaming into the microphone, Car Crash Hearts decided to film their music video by staging a party at Heineken Green Space. Along with the band, the casts of the music video will be none other than the crowd at the party.

Because the song 'Just a Face in the Crowd' speaks about breaking out and not wanting to be caught in a routine, everybody present at the video party stand a chance to break that routine by being a rock star for a day. To add on to the fun, Heineken Green Space is bringing 'indie karaoke' to let fans take on some indie rock classics on stage. But if you prefer to have a little corner on your own to do all the rock-star stunts while singing your lungs out, try the video karaoke booths. (Oh, did we tell you that all these might be captured on film for the music video too?)

The party at Heineken Green Space will be filmed as you sing along with 'Just a Face in the Crowd' and Car Crash Hearts will compile the best clips to be included in their single's music video.

- Kong Wai Yeng

To get tickets, follow Car Crash Hearts on Twitter via @CarCrash Hearts_

address_details.venue_address: Milk Club, 18 Jalan Liku, Bangsar.

eventDetails.price: To get tickets, follow Car Crash Hearts on Twitter via @CarCrash Hearts_

In conjunction with World Press Freedom Day 2010, the Centre of Independent Journalism is organising a forum titled 'Building Peace Across Communities', during which a panel of distinguished media practitioners and media watchers will give their thoughts on this issue and the public are invited to contribute to the discussion for a better understanding all round on how to engage the media for change towards a better Malaysia.

Forum panellists taking part are:
Ms Insany Syahbarwati, head of the Maluku Media Center, Ambon, Indonesia
Dr Mustafa K. Anuar, communication studies lecturer
Ms Jacqueline Ann Surin, editor of The Nut Graph
Prangtip Daoreung, Asian Public Intellectuals Fellow

eventDetails.keyword: Events, May 2010, Mother's Day, Hotel, Equatorial, KL, Celebration, High Tea Buffet, Japanese food
eventDetails.title: Mother's Day Celebration at Hotel Equatorial KL
eventDetails.short_description: Want to show your Mum how much you care this Mother's Day? Hotel Equatorial Kuala Lumpur will be having Mothers' Day Celebration...
eventDetails.descripton:
Hotel Equatorial Kuala Lumpur presents Mother's Day Celebration!
Want to show your Mum how much you care this Mother's Day? Hotel Equatorial Kuala Lumpur will be having Mothers' Day Celebration on Sunday, May 9 2010.

It is a chance for you  to surprise and pamper your mother on this special day with your family members and friends. We have four great  restaurants in the hotel that offers you fabulous promotions to celebrate this joyous occasion and appreciation to your mother - Chalet, Etoile Bistro, Kampachi and Nipah CoffeeShop.

Celebrate Mother's Day with an extensive international High Tea Buffet  at Nipah CoffeeShop. Feast on an endless array of traditional Asian favourites and international cuisine prepared by Chef Aimilan Zainal Abidin. The menu features the favourite Malaysia delights with over 50 types of dishes available. Not that all, mothers will be kept busy with fun games and interesting activities all afternoon at the Nipah Foyer. Mother and child could partake in the cup cake decoration and flower arrangement contests. Also win fabulous prizes for Best Dressed Mother. The High Tea Buffet  is priced at RM65++ per adult and RM35++ per child and available from 12 noon to 5.00pm.

For Japanese food lovers, you can savour authentic Japanese Buffet Brunch at Kampachi on this Mother's Day. At this award-winning restaurant, diners will be served with a wide selection of Japanese cuisine  to fill your hunger. Taste more than 50 types of Kampachi Japanese restaurant's delights such sushi, sashimi, maki mono, teuchi soba, agemono, tempura,  sukiyaki (sliced beef or chicken in special sukiyaki sauce), teppanyaki, chawan mushi, shichimi dofu and many more for your pleasure. The Japanese Buffet Brunch is priced at RM85++ per adult and RM45++ per child.  Every mother will be surprised with attractive door gift.

Pay your most  tribute on Mother's Day at Chalet, the award-winning Swiss restaurant with scrumptious five course set dinner menu specially prepared by our Executive Chef Jochen Kern. Delight her with appetizer such as venison essence wolf berries and lemon mint sherbet with lavender. The main course are choices of  citrus marinated char broiled monkfish, macadamia nut crusted beef tenderloin or roasted loin of Tasmanian spring lamb. End the meal with tantalizing desserts like passion yogurt timbale with coconut ice-cream on mango coulis , chocolate coated straberries and earl gray tea. Mother's Day Set Dinner  is priced at RM190++ per person. Mothers  will also be receiving attractive door gift.

We also offer  tempting and delectable Mother's Day cakes at Etoile Bistro. Enjoy home-made cakes, cup cakes and cookies. It is available for both take away and dine in the Etoile Bistro.

address_details.venue_address: Hotel Equatorial Kuala Lumpur Jalan Sultan Ismail 50250 KL

eventDetails.keyword: Celebrate Mother's Day at Sheraton Imperial KL
eventDetails.title: Celebrate Mother's Day at Sheraton Imperial KL
eventDetails.short_description: Mother's Day is just around the corner. Celebrate it with your MOM at Sheraton KL...
eventDetails.descripton:
Mother's Day is just around the corner and it's that time of the year where we celebrate our love for MOMs who have dedicated their lives to their children.

On May 9, Essence, the all-day-dining restaurant and Celestial Court, the heaven of Cantonese cuisines at Sheraton Imperial Kuala Lumpur Hotel, have each come up with special Mother's Day menus designed to make all mothers feel treasured.

On this special day, treat your mother to a delightful seafood brunch buffet at Essence, with a wonderful and delicious array of seafood specialities, set to tempt all. 

In addition to the sumptuous buffet brunch, Mothers dining at Essence will also be rewarded with a RM50 spa voucher. The RM50 spa voucher is redeemable at the Mandara Spa, located on level 5 of the hotel, which is famed for its wide variety of rejuvenating and revitalizing massage treatments. In fact, Mandara Spa will be providing a 5-minute massage at Essence for all mothers on the day.

Families who prefer authentic Cantonese cuisine can head down to the Celestial Court. The 6-course Mother's Day set menu will be served for lunch, from 12noon to 2.30pm and for dinner, from 6.30pm to 10.30pm. Priced at RM98++ per guest, the set menu includes braised assorted seafood soup with crab meat, crab roe and asparagus; sautéed shrimps with celery in Szechuan hot bean sauce; deep fried cod fish with Thai Pattaya sauce; braised ling-zhi mushrooms with seasonal vegetables; crispy noodles with chicken fillet and choy sum in Supreme stock and not forgetting the dessert, chilled sea coconut with small fungus and gingko nuts.

Advance reservations at Essence and Celestial Court are recommended by calling 03 7179 900 ext 6933 or email restaurants.imperial@sheraton.com.

address_details.venue_address: Sheraton Imperial Kuala Lumpur Hotel Jalan Sultan Ismail 50250 KL

eventDetails.title: Celebrate Mother's Day, The Croatian Way, At Dubrovnik Restaurant
eventDetails.short_description: Bring your mum, your grandmothers, sisters, your whole family down to Dubrovnik Restaurant, located in the heart of Solaris...
eventDetails.descripton:
To honor mums this coming Mother's Day, Dubrovnik Restaurant has tailored something a little different than your traditional sit down dinner!

Bring your mum, your grandmothers, sisters, your whole family down to Dubrovnik Restaurant, located in the heart of Solaris Mont Kiara, for a healthy, hearty and rustic meal.

For starters, the spectacular buffet includes the fresh Shrimp salad in tomato sauce, the Mixed Green Salad and the Palacinke, a Croatian variety of the crepes, filled with cheese. It's a refreshingly light start.

Follow up with the following main course options - scrumptious Chicken dish filled with mushrooms, or with the Lamb Shank Peka, which is Dubrovnik's most popular traditional Croatian dish. Perhaps their Minced Meat Roll or their Romesco Fish will take your fancy, or fulfill your curiosity by sampling all of these buffet dishes all at once! Complement any of them with the side dish options which include the Mediterranean Rice or Baby Potatoes roasted with spices.

Partner your meal either with a non-alcoholic fruit punch, or top it off with coffee or tea.

Add a sweet indulgence to the the special celebratory night with a delicious, wholesome slice of apple and chocolate pie - and you'll definitely make it a night to remember.

Buffet Menu (RM88++ Per Person; mothers will get a special gift from Dubrovnik)

eventDetails.keyword: Copeland, farewell tour, concert, rock concert, PJ
eventDetails.title: Copeland Farewell Asian Tour
eventDetails.short_description: All the good bands are disbanding. Eons ago, The Beatles almost disembowelled the hearts of their die-hard fans...
eventDetails.descripton:
All the good bands are disbanding. Eons ago, The Beatles almost disembowelled the hearts of their die-hard fans when they called it quits (yes, their break-up was that painful). Led Zeppelin was not any better when they'd decided to say goodbye and leave us with weird parodies of their rock music. Now, Copeland is breaking-up too? Who is going to croon us with 'emo' songs during our emotional turbulence?

We love Copeland because they're original and unpretentious. Copeland presents that edge of loneliness, love and longingness in their mellowing music but singer Aaron Marsh never exude that whimper-wailing voice to make you believe in whatever they're singing. Their mid-tempo songs have just the right amount of intensity to force out that emotional side of you but never too compelling to make you cry.

This indie band will make its last performance around Asia in this farewell tour and if you want to soak yourself in their music fecundity one last time, better grab your tickets early folks.

- Kong Wai Yeng

address_details.venue_address: Bentley Music Auditorium, Mutiara Damansara Wisma Bentley Music 3, Jalan PJU 7/2, PJ

eventDetails.title: Mother's Day Celebration at One World Hotel PJ
eventDetails.short_description: Be prepared to enter a world of gastronomic adventure amidst a contemporary setting. In place of the hot chaffing...
eventDetails.descripton:
Come and celebrate this Mother's day at One World Hotel with these special offers!

Mother's Day Buffet Dinner at Cinnamon Coffee House
May 9 2010
6.30pm-10.30pm
RM98++ adult RM49++ child

Make Mother's Day a memorable one not only for Mum but for the whole family! Bring the clan to the award-winning Cinnamon Coffe House, located on the concourse level of One World Hotel, for the Mother's Day special buffet dinner.

Be prepared to enter a world of gastronomic adventure amidst a contemporary setting. In place of the hot chaffing dishes of the usual buffet line is a series of "show kitchens"-featuring an open live cooking kitchen concept which also includes a garden terrace for alfresco dining. Watch our talented chefs in action at the show and interactive kitchens as they wipped up favourites from around the world- it will definitely be a feast for both your eyes and palate. Show kitchens include a Salad bar, Pasta corner, Western counter, Indian counter, Japanese counter, Noodles section, local kitchen and dessert corner. A water feature surrounds the seating area which makes it a perfect ambience for a great meal.


Mother's Day High Tea at Cinnamon Coffee House
May 9 2010
12pm-4.30pm
RM65++ adult RM33++child

Spare Mum the hassle of cooking this Mother's Day. Have a family get-together and treat her to a bountiful high tea spread at Cinnamon Coffee House of One World Hotel. Coax Mum to take part in the cake decorating competition and win attractive dining vouchers.

The high tea spread at Cinnamon features local and international favourites with scrumptious desserts. Chocolate lovers will fall in love with our chocolate fountain at the dessert counter. Not forgetting, the wide variety of freshly sliced tropical fruits, mouth-watering cakes and cookies, ice creams and crepes prepared a la minute by our chef-in-attendance.

A caricature artist will also be available at the foyer of the coffee house if your family is interested to have a family portrait by the artist.

Come and make an early reservation for Mother's Day High Tea or Buffet Dinner at Cinnamon Coffee House.

Mother's Day Set Menus at Zuan Yuan Chinese Restaurant May 1-9 2010

In conjunction with the Education Malaysia 2010 conference, La Salle Centre with the support of the Commonwealth Foundation will be screening Gadoh the movie.

Gadoh is a 70-minute feature film that tells a story of a group of teenagers beset by racial tensions further escalated by their environment and school system. In the ensuing aftermath, one teacher ropes in the help of an old friend and reluctant maverick theatre activist to deal with the bigotry. Is there hope amid the cycle of discrimination that surrounds us?

Directed by Brenda Danker and Nam Ron. Starring Nam Ron, Nick Davis, Zahiril Adzim, Amerul Affendi and Maya Tan Abdullah. Gadoh is produced by Big Pictures Production for KOMAS

For further inquiries and reservations of passes, please email to gadohthemovie@gmail.com with the following information:

eventDetails.keyword: Adam, Musical, Events, March 2010, The Actors Studio, Lot 10, Performance, Adam Musical, KL, Play
eventDetails.title: Adam The Musical
eventDetails.short_description: While preparing for Adam and Sylvia's wedding, Adam is suddenly hospitalised. As Adam lays in his bed, the doctor can only tell Sylvia...
eventDetails.descripton:
While preparing for Adam and Sylvia's wedding, Adam is suddenly hospitalised. As Adam lays in his bed, the doctor can only inform Sylvia saying, 'your husband is not well'…

Sylvia curves down an emotional roller coaster, as her inability to believe how lucky she has been to find Adam now is confirmed. She moves through friends, family and strangers; their stories of life, death, and surviving provide comfort, horror and love.

Their stories indirectly display the past, present and future of Sylvia's life if she chooses to still marry the sleeping Adam.

Adam The Musical is about the dangerous period we live in, of suspicion and fear of people and things we do not know. It is about compassion and strength and how these qualities can turn the gloomy days into one with light, even if it is just a faint one.Adam The Musical is about searching for  true love and knowing that we can be very lucky after all.

eventDetails.title: Obesity The Silent Killer
eventDetails.short_description: A two-day conference designed to provide practical insights into the various issues associated with obesity...
eventDetails.descripton:
The Conference on 'Obesity the silent killer' is a two-day conference designed to provide practical insights into the various issues associated with obesity; from how it is caused, to its impacts on people and society, to analyzing ways to manage, prevent and treat it.

The conference will be held on June 12-13, 2010 at the JW Marriott KL. It will be an exciting and thought-provoking conference on obesity to better understand the dynamics and intricacies of this growing global epidemic, to be able to make informed decisions about lifestyle and seek the right treatment.

Who should attend:
Health professionals, GPs, nurses, dieticians, nutritionists, clinicians, researchers, social workers, therapists, members of the public concern with obesity issues, medical students, Senior Level Management who are concerned with how obesity can affect their staff performance and work efficiency.

For more information, please visit website.

eventDetails.keyword: Wei Ling, Gallery, Art, Events, May 2010, Czech, Glass, Sculptural, Brickfields, KL
eventDetails.title: Contemporary Czech Glass
eventDetails.short_description: Today Czech glass artists are amongst the world's leaders in this field, with their innovative and creative vision coupled...
eventDetails.descripton:
Wei Ling Gallery in association with StudioGlass London, is proud to present a unique exhibition of Contemporary Czech Glass this May 2010.

Since the Middle Ages the Czechs have been recognised for their traditional glass and crystal work, in particular Bohemia Crystal. In the fifties a new generation of modern artists emerged. This group have taken glass-making in the country to another level by re-interpreting it with a contemporary vision.

Today Czech glass artists are amongst the world's leaders in this field, with their innovative and creative vision coupled with a strong technical understanding of the material. Czech glass art is a combination of sculptural and graphic expression.

It is the first time that an exhibition of works by Czech Republic's finest glass artists will be featured in Malaysia.

eventDetails.keyword: French Art and Film Festival 2010, french films, french culture, food, french festival, alliance francaise
eventDetails.title: French Art and Film Festival 2010
eventDetails.short_description: It's time to go French again. From Arts to Film, to Food and performances, there'll be various happenings...
eventDetails.descripton:
It's time to go French again. The French Art and Film Festival is back for its 2010 edition, brought to you by Alliance Française de Kuala Lumpur and the French Embassy in Malaysia. From arts to films, to food and performances, there'll be various happenings around town to keep everybody happy. Check out the listing below: 

May 12 - May 23
French Film Festival
- GSC Pavilion KL, GSC Midvalley, GSC 1 Utama
The French Film Festival opens today, and the silver screen will be graced by French accents and expressions galore including the recent 'Coco before Chanel', and spot Evangeline Lilly in 'Afterwards'.  Log on to www.gsc.com.my for complete synopsis and to make a booking for the film screenings.

May 14 - May 26
Connaître Charlotte Perriand Exhibition
- Shalini Ganendra Fine Art
Perriand is the furniture designer most famous for introducing the 'machine age' of aesthetics that minimalists the world over still relish today (look out for lots of steel and glass).
 
May 15, 8pm
Amour (Dance Performance)
- Lycée Français de Kuala Lumpur, 34 Jalan Dutamas Raya, Taman Segambut, KL (www.lfkl.edu.my)
Fee: FREE
Inspired by Auguste Rodin - most famous for his bronze and marble creation 'The Thinker' - Shanmuga Sundaram will be exploring love through classical dance. 

May 18, 8.30pm
Nouvelle Scene concert by ZAZ
- klpac, Jalan Strachan, off Jalan Ipoh, KL
Fee: RM30, RM15.
ZAZ is a chameleon of a performer, lending her voice to everything from traditional French music to afro-Latino vibes, all with a jazz-swing twist. 

May 20, 8.30pm
Chamber music concert by Trio con Fuoco
- Dewan Filharmonik Petronas, KLCC
Fee: RM10
Dispelling the myth that chamber music is for those with one foot in the grave, the Trio con Fuoco will be performing César Franck's sonata for violin and piano, Gabriel Faure's trio in D minor opus 120 and Johannes Brahms' trio n°1 in B major opus 8.

May 21 - May 27
French Food Festival
- Hilton KL (03 2264 2264/www.kl-studio.com/hilton_kl).
Foodies rejoice! French chefs and sommeliers will be out to prove there's more to French dining than snails and baguettes.

May 22, 8.30pm
Hymnes à l'Amour by Mouron
- Panggung Bandaraya KL
Fee: FREE
In this tribute to French love songs, the critically acclaimed French singer Mouron will be crooning her way through a set of chansons.
 
May 24, 5pm
Martell Cognac Masterclass
- Hilton KL
Learn how to appreciate your brandy in this masterclass dedicated to France's premium liqueur.

For complete program details, please visit www.faff2010.com or www.alliancefrancaise.org.my.

eventDetails.keyword: 游西买车... SIAO! Pilgrims and a Loser, klpac, ma sen
eventDetails.title: 游西买车... SIAO! Pilgrims and a Loser
eventDetails.short_description: A double bill featuring works by Taiwanese centemporary playwright Ma Sen. Directed by Kimmy Kiew...
eventDetails.descripton:
A double bill featuring works by Taiwanese contemporary playwright Ma Sen. Directed by Kimmy Kiew.

In Pilgrim, a monk sets off on a pilgrimage in the desert with an unwelcomed companion. Driven by desperation, a beggar has decided to join him on this pilgrimage thinking that sumptuous food, abundant women and happiness awaits him in the holy land. Of course his vision of the holy land defers from that of the monk's. Do they find this elusive holy land of theirs?

Pilgrims explores mankind's indecisiveness and how a person's decision comes with direct consequences.

In A Loser, man's desire for materialism in the modern world can be so overwhelming. In order to attain worldly wealth, the wife is adamant about purchasing a car. To her, there is only one way to die a noble death: in a car accident.

Performed in Chinese with English surtitles

eventDetails.keyword: Club 8 Live in Malaysia, Bentlet auditorium
eventDetails.title: Club 8 Live in Malaysia
eventDetails.short_description: Formed in 1995, Club 8 became one of the pillars of Swedens pop scene with a string of melodic, eclectic albums...
eventDetails.descripton:
Formed in 1995, Club 8 became one of the pillars of Swedens pop scene with a string of melodic, eclectic albums.

Karolina Komstedt and Johan Angergård recorded their first three songs in 1995. Now releasing albums on an international level, Club 8 continued tinkering with different influences throughout the early 2000s. A self-titled album appeared in 2001 and earned comparisons to Portishead's work, while 2002's Spring Came, Rain Fell was even more experimental and electronic, due in no small part to the construction of the bands own recording studio.

Their upcoming new album, The Peoples Record reflects Johan Angergårds recent immersion in 1970s West African pop music and throws out the restraint and calm the band has always exhibited in favor of a much looser approach.

Catch them live at Wisma Bentley PJ on Tursday, May 13. Supporting them for the night will be local indie darling Liyana Fizi.

address_details.venue_address: Bentley Music Auditorium, 4th Floor, Wisma Bentley Music, 3, Jalan PJU 7/2, Mutiara Damansara, PJ

eventDetails.title: Free Talk entitled Beyond Labels by HANDLE Institute
eventDetails.short_description: Ms. Mary Robson, Regional Educational Director USA & Asia Pacific Regions for the HANDLE Institute is back in KL and will give a...
eventDetails.descripton:
Free Talk entitled Beyond Labels by HANDLE Institute
Ms. Mary Robson, Regional Educational Director USA & Asia Pacific Regions for the HANDLE Institute is back in Kuala Lumpur and will be giving a free talk titled "Beyond Labels." The talk is on the holistic non-drug alternative that will address the root causes of a wide range of learning, behaviour and functioning issues and thus help extraordinary people of all ages do ordinary things.

Beyond Labels-will familiarize you with the concept of neurodevelopment and help you understand the role it plays in behaviour and academic learning. You will learn how behaviours and difficulties can be seen as clues that reveal specific, often treatable body-system issues.

Learn about HANDLE (Holistic Approach to Neuro-Development and Learning Efficiency), a holistic, non-drug alternative that can affectively identify and address the root causes of a wide range of learning, behaviour and functioning issues and "help extraordinary  people of all ages do ordinary things".

eventDetails.keyword: Mandarin Oriental, Hotel, Events, May 2010, Mother's Day, Tribute, Buffet brunch, Dining, Mum, Dessert Island
eventDetails.title: A Mother's Day Tribute at Mandarin Oriental KL
eventDetails.short_description: Celebrate with mums this Mother's Day at Mandarin Oriental, Kuala Lumpur as the hotel offers a bountiful buffet brunch at Biba's Café...
eventDetails.descripton:
Celebrate with mums this Mother's Day at Mandarin Oriental, Kuala Lumpur as the hotel offers a bountiful buffet brunch at Biba's Café , featuring local and international fare that will guarantee a palatable journey of exquisite cuisine.

Begin the journey with the finest assortment of Danish pastries and croissants, freshly baked rolls and miniature muffins and savor the generous servings of appetizers comprising of Grilled vegetables with feta cheese and tarragon-mustard dressing, Hummus, fatoush and mouthabel, Atlantic crab on madras marinated honeydew and Thai spicy squid salad. On the side, venture into a chilled seafood selection of prawns, bleu shell crab, oysters, scallops, mussels with condiments and sauces and tuck into a hearty selection of Roasted leg of lamb with feta and mint jelly, Truffle chicken liver parfait cherry tomato compote and Duck liver terrine with cinnamon apricot compote.

Offering a spicier reminder closer to home is the Malay and Indian sections of Jingha briyani, Pucuk paku masak lemak, Beef rendang, Murtabak ayam, Roti jala and Chicken Tikka while Chinese and Western favourites such as Singapore noodles, Crispy chicken with Sichuan sauce, Peking duck with pancakes and condiments, Eggs benedict with green asparagus and Beef Wellington and Yorkshire pudding gravy will perk up the plate with a mix of refined and traditional flavours. A feast of pasta and pancakes comprising of Mushroom tortellini's in pesto cream sauce or roasted tomato and Savoury pancakes with smoked salmon and ricotta cheese with chives is also offered at the pasta station.

To top it all off, a sweet tribute to mothers is offered at the Dessert Island where specially created Mother's Day delights will form a pleasant indulgent surprise for all mums.

To delight the mothers a surprise complimentary gift will be given out to all mothers dining at our restaurants. In addition, the children are guaranteed a fantastic time as they too are taken care off by enjoying the royal treatment at the Kid's Corner filled with fun activities and a junior buffet spread specially lay out for Mother's Day.

To commemorate mums around the world with sweet I-love-you's and an ideal family gathering, this flavorsome brunch affair at Biba's Café is priced at RM98++ for adults and RM43++ for children under 12 and is from 12.30am to 4.00pm.

address_details.venue_address: Mandarin Oriental, Kuala Lumpur Kuala Lumpur City Centre, PO Box 10905, 50088 KL

eventDetails.keyword: Events, May 2010, Excess, Genting Highlands, Pitbull, R&B, DJ, 12 Hours,Grammy Award
eventDetails.title: 12 HOURS
eventDetails.short_description: This unique global event aims to deliver heart-stopping, high energy performances and showcase some of the biggest...
eventDetails.descripton:
UPDATE: The organiser of the event of the year '12 Hours', Marctensia, today announced that the much awaited event scheduled for 15th May 2010, will now be held at the Bukit Kiara Equestrian Resort Indoor Arena instead. For further information, log on to www.marctensia.com or call their hotline at 03 2092 1199 or visit www.axcess.com.my to purchase your tickets (if you haven't done so)

The first dance music festival of its kind in Malaysia, '12 Hours' will be featuring an all star line up of the current hot acts of its genre.


This unique global event aims to deliver heart-stopping, high energy performances and showcase some of the biggest acts in their respective genres. '12 Hours' crosses and transcends dance music boundaries featuring R&B, House, Trance and Electro music all in one night, on one stage.

Representing the R&B genre, from Miami its Mr.305 Pitbull making his debut performance in Malaysia. Get ready for a night of serious partying!

The ultimate Hard Dance Queen, Lisa Lashes is the most well known female act of her genre in the world. Huge popularity of the sell-out Lashed in Ibiza parties, led to instant worldwide demand for Lisa and her Lashed brand and marathonesque tours of the parties to China, Canada, United States of America, Netherlands, Russia, Australia, New Zealand and Japan ensued.

Roger Shah has made a massive breakthrough in the trance scene over the last two years landing at #21 on this years DJ Mag. In 2007 Armin van Buuren named Shah's 'Who Will Find Me' release as his favourite track of 2007. From there, Magic Island Records - Shah's primary label moved from his own stable to that of one of Armin's industry-leading Armada Music. Roger Shah is one of the few belonging to an elite club of artiste that does live sets as opposed to DJ sets.

Last but not least, is Grammy Award Winning Italian DJ and producer of electro-house music Benny Benassi. Grooving on all remixing cylinders, Benassi has given his magic touch to Mika, Shakira, Flo Rida and Kid Cudi lately and when he plays out it's at full throttle, with his beefed up sets fuelled by indie anthems and house classics.

address_details.venue_address: Indoor Arena, Bukit Kiara Equestrian Resort, KL

Students from the centre will also be featured in the performance.

eventDetails.descripton:
Abundant Australia: highlights from the 11th Venice Architecture Biennale. 

An exhibition featuring over 140 architectural models from prominent Australian architects. The models selected were recently presented at the internationally acclaimed Venice architecture exhibition in the Australian Pavilion.

Abundant Australia reveals a diverse range of styles and concepts key to Australian architecture and is testament to the richness and capacity of both Australia's current architectural practice and its formative history.

Abundant Australia will be exhibited at the National Art Gallery, KL, from 19 April - 16 May 2010.

eventDetails.keyword: Shopping, Around Town, Events, April 2010, May 2010, French Connection, Facebook, Woman, Man, Fashion
eventDetails.title: French Connection-The Man and the Woman Facebook Photo Competition
eventDetails.short_description: French Connection, the premium high street fashion label, is on the prowl for creative entries for its Facebook photo competition entitled...
eventDetails.descripton:
French Connection, the premium high street fashion label, is on the prowl for creative entries for its Facebook photo competition entitled 'The Man' and 'The Woman'. The competition will seek to reward creativity for entrant's perception of 'The Man' and 'The Woman' in a photo with a caption.

The competition is line with French Connection's latest Spring Summer 2010 campaign, 'The Man' and 'The Woman', a series of visually captivating images with witty captions embodying this season's focus to return to the origins of masculinity and femininity, the French Connection way.

In the campaign, French Connection describes 'The Man' as a rugged, bearded and outspoken character who tells other men how to dress. He has the physique of a bareknuckle boxer, the brain of Voltaire and a discerning eye. The Woman' is portrayed as understated, yet sexy. Her description is brief, as we know little of her. She is beautiful, enchanting, capricious and mystifying. We don't even catch her name.

The Facebook photo competition will run from May 1-May 16 2010, and it aims to gather fashion conscious men and women to post up their creative interpretations of 'The Man' and 'The Woman' with a clever and humorous caption. French Connection is giving out prizes worth more than RM2,000.

The winners will be selected based on the most number of 'likes' by fans. The grand prize winner will win RM500 worth of French Conenction merchandise, a campaign T-shirt and a limited-edition gift pack. The next 5 winners will win RM300 worth of merchandise , a campaign T-shirt and a limited-edition gift pack each.

The French Connection Malaysia facebook page will also serve as a portal for local fans, providing the latest information on seasonal offerings, promotions, store activities and future contests.

Does he go for manicure? Does he wear shoes without socks? Does she like pretty colours? How do you project 'The Man' and 'The Woman'?

Be a fan of French Connection Malaysia, and then upload a photo of 'The Man' and 'The Woman' in a masculine or feminine pose on http://bit.ly/French-Connection-Malaysia.

address_details.venue_address: All Participating French Connection Outlets

eventDetails.keyword: Events, Document, Dare, Competition, May 2010, Film, Around Town, Freedom, Festival, Film Makers
eventDetails.title: Freedom Film Fest 2010
eventDetails.short_description: This annual competition which carries the slogan 'DARE TO DOCUMENT' encompasses the spirit of activism through film...
eventDetails.descripton:
The KOMAS FreedomFilmFest 2010 (FFF10) began its annual campaign in promoting socially conscious films with the launch of the film proposal competition in March 2010.

This annual competition which carries the slogan 'DARE TO DOCUMENT' encompasses the spirit of activism through filmmaking and it is the first of its kind to be organised in Malaysia. It has created opportunities for local filmmakers and social activists to use their film making craft to express social concerns and human rights issues.

The Malaysian public is encouraged to pen down their thoughts or issues they feel strongly about in the form of a film proposal.

Three of the chosen best film proposals will be awarded a grant of RM6,000 each and will be supported by KOMAS to transform their proposals into a film.  Winners will also receive the Justin Louis Award and have their films premiere at the FFF2010 screenings in November 2010. Finally one of these winning films will be selected as the "Most Outstanding Human Rights Film".


ENTRY DETAILS

Eligibility: Malaysians aged 18 and above (if below 18 you must submit your entry under a willing and responsible guarantor who will deal with KOMAS for all legal and administrative matters).

Video Format: Documentary / Docudrama / Animation / Graphic

Video Duration: 15 - 30 minutes. 

Video Language: Any widely used dialect in Malaysia but must include English/Bahasa Malaysia subtitles.

Deadline: May 17 2010.

Do not miss this opportunity to get your voices heard! We dare you!

address_details.venue_address: No 40-A, Jalan 52/18, PJ

eventDetails.keyword: May 2010, Amateur, Championship, Events, Travel, Sport, Golf,
eventDetails.title: 108th Malaysian Amateur Open Championship 2010
eventDetails.short_description: Inevitably, the oldest running golf championship in Malaysia will land on the shoreline of Damai Laut Golf & Country Club's...
eventDetails.descripton:
A storm is brewing! Inevitably, the oldest running golf championship in Malaysia will land on the shoreline of Damai Laut Golf and Country Club's internationally acclaimed golf course this May. And being second only to the recently concluded Maybank Malaysian Open 2010, this championship naturally exudes prestige and exclusivity at the highest level and in the international golfing scene.

This year's edition of the Malaysian Amateur Open Championship being the 108th since 1894 will witness 156 golfers from more than fifteen countries competing to improve their ranking and overall positioning in the World Amateur Golf Ranking.

 Apart from the Championship proper, Damai Laut Golf and Country Club (SGRSDL) and the Malaysian Golf Association (MGA) being joint organizers of this prestigious event have also lined up a fabulous offer for all local golfing buffs. A VIP game has been scheduled on 22nd May 2010 where for a small token; golf enthusiasts can stand to compete in this exclusive tournament and pit their skills against specially invited socialites and 'who's who' in the local scene.  But hurry! Only 120 slots are available and they are of course, on 'first come, first serve' basis!

In addition, a public workshop will also be organised to promote and jump start public awareness amongst schoolchildren and youngsters in golf, especially in Perak. Participation into the program is free especially for those who are genuinely interested to acquire the skills and knowledge needed to excel.

eventDetails.keyword: Exhibition, SGFA, Charlotte, Perriand, Events, May 2010,
eventDetails.title: Charlotte Perriand Exhibition
eventDetails.short_description: SGFA will host a dynamic exhibition on renowned architect and designer, Charlotte Perriand, as part of the French Arts Festival...
eventDetails.descripton:
SGFA  will  host  a dynamic  exhibition  on  renowned  architect and designer, Charlotte Perriand, as part of the French Arts Festival.  There will be furnishings designed by Perriand and images,will be on view at the Gallery.

Charlotte Perriand (1903 - 1999) ,is a pioneer of  interior architecture,  introduced the concept of ' fitting-out  adapted to the used', at a time when decorative art had become an institution  and w here the setting imposed its luxury in daily life. 

Collaborating with famed architect Le Corbusier,  she stayed in Japan for several  years , a country which  at that time was unknown to most.  There she built a dogma which become a life long guide - the  ' volumetry of the space'.

occurrences.start_time: Open to visitors every Friday 12pm-7pm, other times by appointment

eventDetails.keyword: Recent paintings by Liu Jing
eventDetails.title: Recent paintings by Liu Jing
eventDetails.short_description: This exhibition of over 30 paintings represent a wide range of Liu Jing's artistic narratives. They range from famous...
eventDetails.descripton:
Liu Jing is from Shanghai but has lived in Malaysia for the last seven years. This exhibition of over 30 paintings represent a wide range of Liu Jing's artistic narratives. They range from famous water towns in China to depictions of traditional musicians. The paintings contain no pseudoprofundity or pretentious socio-political message. They simply express the joy of painting different narratives and they embody aesthetic values for one's aesthetic enjoyment.

The exhibition will be held from 17 April 2010 to 21 May 2010. The official opening by Yoong Sin Min is on Saturday, April 17 at 4pm. All are welcome.

For more details about the exhibition, please visit www.theartgallerypg.com.

eventDetails.keyword: Lea Salonga, broadway music, musical, concert,
eventDetails.title: An Evening with Lea Salonga
eventDetails.short_description: Multiple-award winning and acclaimed international Broadway and West End star Lea Salonga will be gracing...
eventDetails.descripton:
Multiple-award winning and acclaimed international Broadway and West End star Lea Salonga will be gracing the Plenary Hall at Kuala Lumpur Convention Centre on the 22nd and 23rd May 2010 for her first ever appearance in Malaysia, in 'An Evening with Lea Salonga'.

Lea Salonga is a Filipina singer and actress who is best known for her debut musical role in Miss Saigon. She was the first Asian to play Eponine in the musical Les Misérables on Broadway and in 2002, Salonga played the role of a Chinese immigrant in a reinterpretation of Rodgers and Hammerstein's Flower Drum Song opposite Jose Llana. The Salonga-led Broadway revival cast album was also a top contender at the 2003 Grammy Awards for Best Musical Show Album.

Lea Salonga has won the Olivier Award, Tony Award, Drama Desk Award, Outer Critics Award, Theatre Los Angeles Ovation Awards and the Theatre World Awards. Salonga is also renowned as the singing voice of two Disney Princesses - Princess Jasmine from Aladdin and Fa Mulan for the two Mulan movies.

Tickets are available for purchase with Ticket Axcess at www.axcess.com.my / 03 7711 5000. For more information, visit www.aneveningwithleasalonga.my.

address_details.venue_address: Plenary Hall, Kuala Lumpur Convention Centre, KLCC, KL

eventDetails.keyword: Events, May 2010, KL PAC, Pentas 2, Sentul, Performance, Comedy, Play, English, Teachers
eventDetails.title: My English Teachers
eventDetails.short_description: Some of them are under attack not because they are bad but more so because they are too good to the extent that...
eventDetails.descripton:
My English Teachers displays the EXTREME, the FUNNY and the WEIRD English teachers, through the eyes of three friends.

Akmal, an architect, Iski, a lawyer and YY, an engineer,  reminisce about how they struggled to learn English while they were young and cash-strapped.

Akmal is frustrated with his English teachers for they are not able to answer most of his questions. Akmal then turns to songs to learn English. Unfortunately all the songs he chooses are about kissing and making love instead.

Iski, studies English on his own by memorizing words from the dictionary and by eavesdropping. He ends up using bombastic words to the annoyance of his listeners.

YY, finds a creative way to learn English. He gets himself two girlfriends. He learns from one and practises with the other. The two girls are surprised at his progress. One day he is caught and his 'classes' with his two girlfriends comes to an abrupt end.

The three of them decide to attend English classes illegally. They sit outside the classroom and listen to the teaching. Unfortunately, they are caught by the teacher. The teacher takes pity on them and becomes instrumental in their education.
Finally, they succeed in life and pay tribute to all their English teachers.

eventDetails.keyword: Dendongeng, Art, May 2010, Valentine, Willie Fine Art, Free, Dendongeng, Malay Folklore, Mat Jenin, Badang, Exhibition
eventDetails.title: Dendongeng
eventDetails.short_description: Coined from the word Dendangan (a graceful style of singing) and Dongeng (myth), Dendongeng is an exhibition that reveals...
eventDetails.descripton:
Coined from the word Dendangan (a graceful style of singing) and Dongeng (myth), Dendongeng is an exhibition that reveals the Malay folklore in the form of painting. This catchy rhythmic resonance certainly reflects the two important cultural acts in the Malay folklore.

Artist Jalaini Abu Hassan features some of the common characters in the Malay old-aged stories: Mat Jenin the dreamer and Badang, the eater of a demon's vomit. Through Jalaini's skillful employment of the pop vernacular to rearrange, reinterpret and retell new versions of the Malay myths, you can also observe the meticulousness of the artist to bring the paintings.

eventDetails.keyword: Youth 10, Events, May 2010, Around Town, Music, Performance, Sport, Festival, Exhibitions, PWTC
eventDetails.title: Youth Festival 2010
eventDetails.short_description: Youth'10, Malaysia largest youth festival, is back for a third year running. It will take place from May 28-30 2010 at Putra World...
eventDetails.descripton:
Youth' 10 is Back! Which is Malaysia's largest youth festival, is back for a third year running. The festival brings Malaysian youth of all backgrounds together to participate in over a hundred activities. There will be talks, exhibitions and activities on topics such as entrepreneurship, career, education, arts, technology, health, entertainment, sports and community building.

Created based on feedback and recommendations from youths of Malaysia themselves. This event is based on the success of the inaugural YOUTH'08 and YOUTH'09 which collectively hosted over 200 exciting youth activities and attracted over 36, 000 youth participants. YOUTH'10 this year will be organised by Youth Asia.

The objective of YOUTH'10 is to provide a platform that connects the most influential youths with businesses and brands, government agencies and ministries, Malaysian leaders and icons and youth centric leisure activities. The businesses, ministries, leaders and activities are selected and invited strictly based in demands of youths.

eventDetails.descripton:
Hot Indonesian diva Rossa will be back to entertain her Malaysian fans on Saturday May 29 in the Konsert Melodi Cinta Rossa, to be held at the Stadium Putra Bukit Jalil.

The concert will also see Rossa performing with 50 children from the Permata Negara Programme, plus 20 other children from the Tunas Budaya group under the National Arts and Culture Department. There will also be special appearances from popular singer Aizat and Indonesian band ST12 and Ungu.

Among the hit songs that Rossa is expected to perform will be Ayat Ayat Cinta, Pudar, Terlalu Cinta, Atas Nama Cinta, Nada Nada Cinta, Tegar, Terlanjur Cinta (duet with Pasha Ungu) and many more. Two full hours of Rossa - definitely worth the entry fee.

Tickets are on sale now and can be purchased from Axcess Ticketing (03 7711 5000 / www.axcess.com.my)

eventDetails.keyword: Time In, Events, Performance,Funny, Call for entries, April 2010, Cerita Lawak, Gua, Competition, Fame
eventDetails.title: Cerita Lawak Gua Competition
eventDetails.short_description: If you think that setting your cat's tail on fire or farting non stop in the LRT is hilarious enough to win some big bucks, good. Announce...
eventDetails.descripton:
If you think that setting your cat's tail on fire or farting non stop in the LRT is hilarious enough to win some big bucks, good. Announce your creativity to the nation by joining Cerita Lawak Gua - a competition that appreciates your funny gigs and grants you, probably, a few minutes of fame.

              To be RM2,000 richer, you will need to squeeze all your creative juices to tickle the funny bone of the judges. Choose your method of embarrassment - acting, slapstick and even staged accidents. If you think hurting yourself is a little too much to bear, make fun of your animals instead (watch out for PETA!). Videotaping your chihuahua on a roller coaster ride may look mercilessly funny, but remember that no animals should be hurt in the process. If funny moments of your adorable kids, stupid human tricks or animal mishaps still don't work, feel free to create your own animation or cartoon characters in English or Malay.

              The contest will run for three consecutive months; March, April and May; and will crown three top winners monthly through SMS or online voting during the preliminary stages. Each month, the top three winners will receive RM200 (third), RM300 (second) and RM500 (first). The first prize winners for each month will go through another round of judging by Harith Iskander and Din Beramboi to win the Grand Cash Prize of RM2,000. Tip for amateur comedy movie-makers: the judges are looking for something original, likeable and that perhaps has commercial value. Send in your funniest video and laugh your way to the bank.

Kong Wai Yeng
   
Closing date May 31, 2010

The 2010 FIFA World Cup, the 19th FIFA World Cup, the premier international football tournament kicks off on June 11 in South Africa and at Bentley's Pub!  It is no fun watching the tournament all by yourself.  Gather all your football fanatic friends together and watch the games 'live' at Bentley's Pub.  Cheer your favourite team on and celebrate their victory with a bottle of 'The Great American Lager', Budweiser and a whole range of World Cup Snacks.  Featured on the World Cup Snack Menu are delicious items such as German Curry Sausage; Tex-Mex Soccer Fries; Sambal Brazil Striker; South African Warrior and Blue Azurri.

Rice Dumpling Festival:  June 1-16 2010
Rice Dumpling Festival or Dragon Boat Festival falls on the 5th day of the 5th month on the lunar calendar and is widely a celebrated festival amongst the Chinese, to pay respect to the patriotic poet, Qu Yuan.
The rice dumplings are glutinous rice wrapped in bamboo leaves or lotus leaves with an assortment of fillings or just simply without filling. They could be just white rice dumpling or brown. 

In celebration of this annual festival, Toh Lee Chinese Restaurant's Dim Sum Chef Lo Tian Sion has concocted three different variations to add a touch of difference to this occasion:  Mutli Grain Glutinous Rice Dumpling; Rendang Chicken and Shrimp Floss Dumpling and 'Kwai Far' Dumpling with Imo and Vanilla Ice Cream.
RM18.00++ to RM48.00++ per selection

Ever wonder how to make rice dumplings??  Here's your opportunity to learn from the master at the one-day Rice Dumpling Culinary Class on 5th June at 10.00 am at Toh Lee Chinese Restaurant.

eventDetails.keyword: Saya Nak Cuti!, MAS, Astro RIA
eventDetails.title: Saya Nak Cuti!
eventDetails.short_description: Seven winners of the Malaysia Airlines, 'Saya Nak Cuti!' contest celebrated winning a 'once-in-a-lifetime opportunity...
eventDetails.descripton:
Seven winners of the Malaysia Airlines, 'Saya Nak Cuti!' contest celebrated winning a 'once-in-a-lifetime' opportunity to live out an all expense paid dream holiday, and to host their own TV programme.

Chosen from over 3,000 entries, the winners are: Mohammed Amyrol Bakhri, 25 (Bangkok); Aliff Ashari, 20 (Jogjakarta); Affandi Abdul Hamid, 35 (Tawau); Siti Nur Aishah Aleyes, 26 (Kota Kinabalu); Madina Yahya, 31 (Ho Chi Minh); Juliana Niza Ismail Adnan, 31 (Bali); and Nur Fadhilah Hasnawi, 21 (Sandakan).



The winning entries resonated with the judges and voters.  For example, Madina's story was emotionally gripping. Her mother was from Vietnam and her father, Cambodia. During the war, her parents escaped to Thailand. Raised in Malaysia, Madina has never met her mother's family back in Vietnam. For her, it would be a dream come true to meet her maternal relatives.

A production crew will follow each winner, documenting the dream vacation which will be aired as a 30 minute show on Astro RIA (Channel 104) beginning 21 April 2010 at 10pm.

The 'Saya Nak Cuti' episodes will be aired online at www.MAStraveller.com/SayaNakCuti the day after its airing on Astro RIA.

address_details.venue_address: Astro RIA (Channel 104) and on-line (URL above)

eventDetails.keyword: Discovery Channel, The Colony
eventDetails.title: Discovery Channel's The Colony
eventDetails.short_description: What would you do in the wake of a global catastrophe? How would you find the very basics of survival: food, water and shelter?...
eventDetails.descripton:
What would you do in the wake of a global catastrophe? How would you find the very basics of survival: food, water and shelter? THE COLONY is a controlled experiment that attempts to determine exactly what it would take to survive and rebuild a functioning new society when the world we have grown accustomed to is destroyed.

THE COLONY, a brand new series from Discovery Channel (Astro Channel 551), premieres every Wednesday at 10pm (Malaysia Time) starting April 7. Encores Wednesdays at 3pm, Thursdays at 1am, Saturdays at 7pm and Sundays at 6pm.

In THE COLONY, a group of ten volunteers, whose backgrounds and expertise represent a cross-section of modern society, are isolated for two months in an urban environment in downtown Los Angeles and tasked with creating a livable society. With no electricity, no running water and no communication with the outside world, all they have to work with are their skills, and whatever tools and supplies they scavenge from their surroundings.

Episode descriptions:

Arrival and Survival
Ten volunteers enter an experimental world to see if they can survive and rebuild after a global disaster. Cordoned off in a downtown Los Angeles warehouse, they must secure shelter, filter water, and defend their new home from thieves.

Power Struggle
With the wood smoke generator starting to falter, the volunteers form a search party to find more supplies to re-engineer their power grid. After finding solar panels on a nearby roof, the volunteers spot a pair of new arrivals to THE COLONY, two people roaming freely in the outside world in search of food, shelter and a home... or so the volunteers think.

Comfort in Chaos
After securing the basic necessities for survival, the volunteers focus on the one creature comfort they can't live without: a hot shower. But focusing on comfort leaves them open to a massive attack that threatens their long-term survival.

Safety and Security
After an attack shatters the volunteers' sense of security, they focus on building weapons and fortifying the warehouse. But before they can finish, a truckload of gun-toting traders arrives to test the volunteers' unity.

A Stranger Among Us
The volunteers have the opportunity to up their electricity and power capabilities when they scavenge a stock of abandoned solar panels. But the experiment takes a violent turn when a stranger breeches their security and tries to steal their supplies.

Loss and Communication
The volunteers are rocked by the disappearance of a treasured member during a search party mission. The loss spurs them to build a collection of communication devices in hopes that their missing member is somewhere out there listening.

A Test of Faith
The Colonists run into missionaries on a river trip, and John V's moral compass is shaken. The arrival of two new visitors creates an internal rift and the group must sacrifice one of their own to survive.

Recon Mission
A kidney stone puts Joey down for the count, and while he recovers, the Colonists are surprised by a new arrival and a very wet situation. Mike and Vlad set out on what turns into a dangerous Recon Mission.

Breaking Point
As their resources dwindle, the Colonists work on a scout vehicle and start to customise their escape truck. Tempers flare when the traders return and Joey reaches his breaking point.

Exodus
Mike recovers from a nasty crash and helps the others beef up the Colony's defenses. Then, the Colonists race to finish the escape truck before the marauders launch their final offensive.

occurrences.start_time: Every Wednesday at 10pm. Encores Wednesdays at 3pm, Thursdays at 1am, Saturdays at 7pm and Sundays at 6pm

Hosted by title sponsors, Standard Chartered Bank Malaysia for the second time, this year's race will flag off and end at Dataran Merdeka on 27 June, 2010. With various categories to suit the running preference and needs of a wide array of participants, this year's KL marathon will include a new category for 'veterans' and feature a new list of benefitting charities. This year's run will also showcase a revised and improved route, further showcasing the uniqueness of Kuala Lumpur with its historical landmarks and famous tourist attractions.

Log on at www.kl-marathon.com to participate in the Standard Chartered KL Marathon 2010.  There'll be 7 categories this year, so take your pick:

Full Marathon 42.195km, Half Marathon 21.1km, 10km individual run, Corporate Challenge, 5km fun run (ind), 5km fun run (family) and Kids dash (3km & 950m).

Shabu-shabu May 1 -31 2010
Shabu-shabu is a Japanese variant of hot pot with thin slices of meat and vegetables submerged in a pot of boiling broth made with kelp.  Cooked meat and vegetables are usually dipped in ponzu or 'goma' sauce before eating.  Considered a winter dish but eaten year-round, Shabu-shabu takes focus at Benkay Japanese Restaurant throughout the month of May. 
Come by and have a 'swish-swish' time with the Shabu-Shabu set of beef, chicken, mixed vegetables, udon and rice.
RM150.00++ per person

eventDetails.title: NOVA-Exploring the New Media
eventDetails.short_description: Galeri Petronas proudly presents NOVA-Exploring the New Media, featuring awe-inspiring and innovative works from...
eventDetails.descripton:
Galeri Petronas proudly presents NOVA-Exploring the New Media, featuring awe-inspiring and innovative works from young star designers. This exhibition is held in conjunction with the Kuala Lumpur Design Week Festival 2010.

NOVA - Exploring the New Media includes five integral components of recent New Media Art works. The artists selected for this exhibition are recognised for bringing in the latest in this genre:

· Devilrobot Toys  which is a collection of rare vinyl toys by DEVILROBOTS, an internationally renowned five-man Japanese design team

· Digitisation Exhibition is a diverse variety of digital artworks created by Malaysia's emerging graphic designers.

· DOTMOV Festival by Shift Japan is a video art series consisting a selection of 19 digital films out of 264 entries from 30 countries for a digital film festival organised by Shift, a Japanese online creative magazine.

· The Haroshi Exhibition is an eight three-dimensional art pieces sculpted from used skateboards that are cut out into mosaics, dots and pixels by Haroshi.

· The Windcatcher is an interactive art installation by a Shanghai-based team of designers called Super Nature Design that received an honourable mention during the Seoul Design Olympiad Awards 2009.

eventDetails.descripton:
For the first time in Asia, catch revered management thinkers and best selling authors, James Suroweicki and Malcolm Gladwell, who will challenge Malaysia audiences to think beyond their conventional views about leadership and success.
 
James Suroweicki will be discussing the 'Wisdom of Crowds' and 'The Future of Leadership', and explain how to get people to work better together, and strategies for turning collective knowledge into a true competitive advantage.
 
Malcolm Gladwell will then take you on a journey to the world of 'Outliers' which is the best and the brightest, the most famous and the most successful. Malcolm Gladwell will be examining what makes high achievers different and how you can learn from their experiences to achieve greatness in your own world.

Through sharing remarkable insights and factors that contribute to high levels of success, both personally and professionally, this is going to be an enriching seminar for reflecting and charting of what people need to do in work and life.

eventDetails.keyword: Son Mulato, Qba, Qba Latin Bar & Grill, The Westin Kuala Lumpur, Latin Music,
eventDetails.title: Son Mulato
eventDetails.short_description: This vibrant quintet oozes a distinct Latin charm, playing an extensive and diverse selection of genres within Latin music...
eventDetails.descripton:
Refresh and excite your senses with a fresh wave of Latin Heat at Qba Latin Bar & Grill with Colombian band Son Mulato. This vibrant quintet oozes a distinct Latin charm, playing an extensive and diverse selection of genres within Latin music such as Salsa, Merengue, Samba, Rumba, Reggaeton, Bossanova and Latin Jazz.

Vocalists Viviana and Tatiana believe that the music they play will appeal to everyone, not just Latin music lovers. Paired with the sultry vocals of lead vocalist, Guiovanna, Son Mulato promises to entertain and have you dancing the night away. Besides the attractive vocalists, 'Karibe' also features Conga player Jairo and Dionisio on the keyboards.

If you are looking for a dash of Latin American twist after a day of work, 'Son Mulato' will definitely bring you the Latin Heat with their passionate singing and dancing.

Qba Latin Bar & Grill opens every Monday to Saturday, from 5.00pm until late; 'Son Mulato' performs from Mondays through to Saturdays from 10.30pm till late.

address_details.venue_address: The Westin Kuala Lumpur, 199, Jalan Bukit Bintang, KL

eventDetails.keyword: Everyday Special at Neo, Neo Global Tapas & Luxe Lounge, chill out in KL, KL night, after work hangout
eventDetails.title: Everyday Special at Neo
eventDetails.short_description: Need a place to hang out after work, to release those pent up anger and frustation? Head down to Neo...
eventDetails.descripton:
Need a place to hang out after work, to release those pent up anger and frustation? Head down to Neo, the global tapas and luxe lounge, where every day is special. Hang out with your buddies, refresh and recharge yourself.

Neo everyday special:

Chill Monday
- Drop the phone. Shake off the Monday Blues with 30% off cocktails from 5pm - 8pm

Kan-Pai @ KL City Tuesday
- remember this word: KAN-PAI. Say this word with every order of the grazing platter (good for two) and receive two complimentary drinks (from 5pm - 8pm only)
- Plus 30% off on cocktails all night long after 8pm

Blackberry Wednesday
- Got a Blackberry? Flash it and got drinks 1 for 1 (only from 5pm - 8pm). Enjoy 30% off on cocktails all night long after 8pm

Thursday Fit Freak
- Flash your gym membership card; pay only RM120 for a healthy heart multi-course diet at Tamarind Hill (Normal RM185).
- Chill out at Neo after dinner and receive a complimentary welcome drink
- Enjoy 30% off on cocktails all night long

Neo-rotic Friday
- Are you feeling neo-rotic? Try the Cool Combo; one dozen fresh mix oysters plus 2 hors d'ouvres at RM180++ (good for two)
- Crazy prize; a bottle of Prosseco only RM140++
- 30% off cocktails from 5pm - 8pm

Stiletto Saturday
- Neo ladies who strut to Neo in killer heels get discounts on their cocktails. The higher your heel the less you pay. Every inch gives you 10% off. ladies with slim heels of less than 1cm get a free welcome drink too. This stylish privilege is exclusively for ladies. So, flaunt your heels and cheers.
- For the guys, 30% off cocktails from 5pm - 8pm

eventDetails.keyword: Hilton PJ, March 2010, Hotel, Chocolate, Cake, Pastry, Chef, Caffe Cino, Signature, Events
eventDetails.title: Signature Chocolate Cake At Caffe Cino Hilton PJ
eventDetails.short_description: Petaling Jaya, Malaysia, 10 march 2010-Mouth-watering signature chocolate cake is available at RM26++ at Caffe Cino...
eventDetails.descripton:
Hilton Petaling Jaya's Caffe Cino will be offering a mouth watering signature chocolate cake that is available at RM26++onwards.

Tagged at RM65++ originally, only 100 of signature chocolate cakes are available daily, to ensure the thick and moisture quality of the cake. Hence, to avoid disappointment, it is wise to place reservation a few days in advance.

Synonymous with Hilton Petaling Jaya's warm hospitality and quality service , the signature chocolate cake promises you a dense aroma and lavish chocolate taste. To sink your teeth into the marvelous cake, start off with a sweet strawberry, a chocolate stick and a piece of round chocolate which lie on top of the nice sheen of chocolate coat, before introducing the tantalising chocolate cake to your taste bud.

The only way to enjoy this decadent offering is to savour it gently, let the cake slowly melt in your mouth, before exploding in a burst of rich flavours. Sense of satisfaction and pleasure instantly reign your mind even after the first bite.

The signature chocolate cake is not only a memorable gift to express your gratitude but also a perfect gift to your love ones as well. It delivers your message and sincerity to the recipients. Besides serving as a delectable present, share the signature chocolate cake and your happiness with family and friends at any special occasions.

With the chef's years of experience in pastry and use of luxury ingredient, the signature chocolate cake has won compliments from patrons. It is definitely worth trying particularly for such an exclusive price.
